alert.note: Alert for Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 04 at 6:46PM EST until February 05 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Barbourville affecting Knox County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Barbourville. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM EST Friday the stage was 21.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.4 feet by early Saturday morning. - Action stage is 21.5 feet. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. The next statement will be issued BY 11 PM.
